data.title: Added word wrapping to in-game chat (fixes #2093)
data.body: Added word wrapping to in-game chat (fixes #2093)

data.title: Fixed repairing landed airplanes
data.body:
This is most likely issue #2365

When an airplane was landed and ordered to another airport or service depot, the approach distance was not properly calculated since it was not taken into effect that its current altitude is zero. The result was that the plane was unable to land and returned to the airport.

data.title: Airplanes should not reveal that much on the ground
data.body:
While in the air, airplanes have large reveal range due to their altitude, however on the ground it should be limited - their reveal range on the ground is currently much beyond anything else which should not be the case.

Probably the best would be either to linearly increase their reveal range depending on the altitude or have a separate reveal range for when they are landed.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/100235-airplanes-should-not-reveal-that-much-on-the-ground?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Check for PixelShader version on Windows installation
data.body: Saw http://xnainstaller.codeplex.com/ do this. Can also be achieved with http://nsis.sourceforge.net/PixelShaderCheck

data.title: Improve the build system
data.body:
I did some research as I am not very happy with the current build system. We currently use a Makefile based approach next to the Solution (.sln) File. This should get merged. https://github.com/PintaProject/Pinta seems to have solved this nicely.
- use autotools to check for dependencies
- build everything with xbuild instead of compiling manually
- check everything with RALint also when using IDEs

This should solve mono3 problems #2454 because the name of the compilers have changed and I guess xbuild will automatically invoke the right one. We also can't yet ship Mono.NAT because of compilation problems #2403 and I think this is also due to the hacky Makefile approach. It also does not care about system libraries. There should be a configure that will prefer the use of DLLs in the gac cache if they are the correct version.

data.title: cross-platform SHP viewer and editor with GUI
data.body:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Pixelart explains how to use our command line tool. This is not very user-friendly and alienates Windows users. There is also no quick GUI for Linux to preview SHPs. There are several solutions, but none solves everything:
- https://github.com/katzsmile/OpenRA/tree/master/SHPViewer is written in C#, tight to OpenRA, though Windows only, also supports TS/RA SHPs. Might be worth improving on that one.
- http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=83&t=16068 wants to do a whole IDE (including a YAML editor). Only screenshots, no release/source-code, Windows-only?
- http://www.ppmsite.com/?go=shpbuilderinfo Open Source, supports even RA2/TS graphics, has a pixel editor, but can't save in TD/RA1 format and Windows only.
- http://xhp.xwis.net/ can extract .mix files and preview lot's of Westwood formats, Windows only
- http://content.open-ra.org/ uses a Python script to generate animated GIF and PNG previews of SHPs
- OpenRA.Editor previews buildings and units if they are defined in a mod.yaml for placement on the maps. No quick preview and several limitations in the rendering.

data.title: Have mergable chrome YAMLs
data.body: Currently you can inherit and merge game rule *.yamls which can be exploited for https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Translation because logic and translatable strings can be separated for easy maintenance and to always have a safe fallback. The chrome *.yaml files don't allow that crashing the game when duplicate nodes of the tree are detected. So if a coder changes something to the GUI code he has to update all the translation files because they will crash, if not updated. This is not practical.

data.title: made all in-game strings customisable via .yaml files
data.body: To facilitate https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Translation

data.title: don't hardcode custom prerequisites anymore
data.body: Removing those hacks prepares for https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Translation.

data.title: Added Level1 AI with HackyAI capabilities
data.body:
Hi Maintainers ;)

I rewrote the HackyAI for further extensions. The HackyAI was/is indeed Hacky, not only in the way it works but also how code was structured. The main intention of this changeset is that the individual tasks of the AI (attack, base building, damage repair, rally points, unit building) are separated from a code perspective (and clear visible). The naming "Level1" is from my humble understanding that the AI will anyway evolve in iterations (e.g. Level2 => an AI which actually has a plan, Level3 => an AI which actually is reduced by war fog) and HackyAI is now just Level1. "Little" extensions like super power use or simple ship/air strategies can be integrated in the Level1 as a "Strategy"

PULL hints:
- System.yaml and the .csproj needs to be merged manually as openRA bleed and my bleed differ quite a bit. (sorry for that, I am new to Git and GitHub)
- HackyAI and Level1AI co-exist, Level1 AI is completely in a separate folder.
- As I also did a code cleanup and a file based restructuring, diff will not really help ;)
- I can also understand, that you integrate the code but do activate it yet for the next release (by system.yaml) due to release stability concerns.

Hope to hear from you guys.
# 

Added Level1 AI (assuming several attempts to create a good AI)
- Moved all HackyAI code into 5 individual strategies (attack, base
  building, damage repair, rally points, unit building)
- Generated Level1 AI environment

Code Cleanup
- Removed var (readability)
- Added new lines (readability)
- Removed multiple exit points (reduce complexity)
- Added argument guards (maintainability)
- Changed variable names (readability)
- Added source code comments (maintainability)

data.title: On screen or in game help
data.body:
It could be nice to have an in game help that would show every available shortcuts when you press the H key.

An other option would be to add an help screen in the game menu.

data.title: One nuke strike per missile silo
data.body:
We should get one independent nuke strike per missile silo.

If it's not possible, then nuke strike delay should be decreased for each missile silo you control.

data.title: Can't attack when a medic is selected
data.body: If you have a medic among the units you have selected, you won't be able to attack an ennemy unit or building (unless you use the CTRL button to force an attack)

Could also be a quick button for going back to lobby with players on the same teams, the same map selected...

data.title: MIG Improvements
data.body:
The MIG is pretty darn expensive and carries a lot of risk in that cost. We found ourselves never building the plane, because Yaks were just as effective for the vast majority of use cases. This patch gives MIGs back the base strike ability they once had, with the added bonus that they are excellent in air-to-air combat (which they should be).
- MIG is now faster
- Longbow is now slightly faster
- MIG carries more firepower
- MIG missiles are faster
- MIG can fire anti-air

data.title: Three new 5-player RA maps
data.body:
We find ourselves with five players a lot. These maps make for an entertaining shift from the usual melees.
- The White Pentagon - snow based land/water map with minimal obstructions.
- Black Gold - Resource starved map with each starting position receiving 8 oil derricks.
- Texas Sea - Similar to Black Gold, but every starting position is on a tiny island.

data.title: Don't auto-target the neutral badger that drops crates!
data.body: Those crates are useful! We've noticed that the badger can get auto-targeted and shot down quite often... let's not do that.
